title: Harry Dunn's parents call for diplomat's wife to face justice over son's death – video
text:
The family of Harry Dunn, killed in a crash allegedly involving Anne Sacoolas, a US diplomat's wife, say they are prepared to travel to the US to fight her diplomatic immunity claim.

Speaking on the BBC's Victoria Derbyshire programme, Dunn's mother, Charlotte Charles, said: 'If she had stayed ... We'd have tried to get her a suspended sentence so she could have continued being a mum ... but forgiving her for leaving? I'm nowhere near.'

Dunn's father, Tim, said the family was prepared to travel to the US to appeal to Donald Trump for her to face justice
description: Dunn's father, Tim, said the family would travel to the US to appeal to the president to waive Sacloolas' diplomatic immunity
